intro: Kentrophyta wolfii, commonly known as the wolf's bane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Kentrophyta wolfii is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. It is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
